derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from late Latin manifestatio(n-), from the verb manifestare 'make public'

entry.def: A manifestation of something is one of the different ways in which it can appear.

example.ex: Different animals in the colony had different manifestations of the disease...
example.tran: 在这一群体里，这种疾病在不同的动物身上有着不同的表现。

example.ex: New York is the ultimate manifestation of American values.
example.tran: 纽约是美国价值观的终极体现。

means.word_mean: 2. a manifest indication of the existence or presence or nature of some person or thing;
3. an appearance in bodily form (as of a disembodied spirit)

sentences.sentence: "the pulse is a reflection of the heart's condition"

means.word_mean: 5. a public display of group feelings (usually of a political nature);

sentences.sentence: "there were violent demonstrations against the war"
